intro: Mikania bishopii, commonly known as the Bishop's mikania, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in small heads. Mikania bishopii is considered an endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive competition.
